CHEMICALS

ketamine

Modern humans must learn how to relate to psychoactives responsibly, treating them with respect and awareness, working to minimize harms and maximize benefits, and integrating use into a healthy, enjoyable, and productive life.

Ketamine



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

K; Special K; Cat Tranquilizer


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears in the Erowid website's library and informational resources section, just before a detailed entry on ketamine in the "Chemicals" vault. It lists book and document resources, then transitions to contact/support options and finally begins the comprehensive ketamine overview, including names, classification, and responsible use guidance.

metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault
metadata.description: Information about Ketamine including basics, effects, dosage, history, legal status, photos, research, media coverage, and links to other resources.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Ketamine including basics, effects, dosage, history, legal status, photos, research, media coverage, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Ketamine



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

K; Special K; Cat Tranquilizer

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Dissociative Anaesthetic; Psychedelic

CHEMICAL NAME

2-(2-chlorophenyl)-2-(methylamino)-cyclohexanone

DESCRIPTION

Ketamine is a dissociative psychedelic used medically as a veterinary and human anaesthetic. It is one of the few addictive psychedelics and is associated with researcher John Lilly.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

GENERAL INFORMATION #

Ketamine FAQ

Variation in Effects between Batches of Ketamine

Ketamine & Drug Tests

Miscellaneous Dissociative Info

General Ketamine Info

Ketamine Bits & Pieces

HISTORY #

Ketamine Timeline

CHARACTERS #

John Lilly

HEALTH #

Ketamine Fatalities / Deaths

KLUTS: Ketamine and Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms

Ketamine and Depression

This is your Brain on Dissociatives

The Bad News Isn't In

Ketamine for Worms

ASK EROWID ANSWERS #

What substances are "K" and "G"?


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is the main informational entry for ketamine within Erowid’s Chemicals Index, providing its common and brand names, effects classification, chemical name, medical and recreational description, key sections (basics, effects, images, health, law, dose, chemistry), and links to detailed general information, history, notable figures, health impacts, FAQs, and user-submitted questions.
